graphics.newImageSheet()

Type function
Library [graphics.*][api.graphics]
Return value ImageSheet
Revision Current Public Release (2013.2076)
Keywords
Sample code /CoronaSDK/SampleCode/...
See also [display.newImageGroup()][api.display.newImageGroup]
Creating Button Widgets

Overview

Description here.

Syntax

graphics.newImageSheet( filename, [baseDir, ] options )
filename (required)

String. Short description here.

baseDir (optional)

Constant. Short description here.

options (required)

Table. Short description here.

Formats for options

Basic

This configuration assumes all frames in the image sheet texture share identical properties. All table parameters below belong directly to the options table (above).

local options =
{
    width = 50,
    height = 50,
    numFrames = 3
}
width (required)

Number. Short description here.

height (required)

Number. Short description here.

numFrames (required)

Number. Short description here.

sourceWidth (optional)

Number. Short description here.

sourceHeight (optional)

Number. Short description here.

sourceX (optional)

Number. Short description here.

sourceY (optional)

Number. Short description here.

Advanced

This configuration is required if the image sheet has frames of varying sizes. In this configuration, options is an array of tables that each represent a single frame in the image sheet texture. All parameters below belong to a table within the options array.

local options =
{
    -- FRAME 1:
    {
        x = 00,
        y = 70,
        width = 50,
        height = 50
    },

    -- FRAME 2:
    {    
        x = 50,
        y = 70,
        width = 45,
        height = 55
    },

    -- FRAME 3... and so on...
}
x (required)

Number. Short description here.

y (required)

Number. Short description here.

width (required)

Number. Short description here.

height (required)

Number. Short description here.

sourceWidth (optional)

Number. Short description here.

sourceHeight (optional)

Number. Short description here.

sourceX (optional)

Number. Short description here.

sourceY (optional)

Number. Short description here.

Examples

Example title

local widget = require "widget"

local function onButtonRelease( event )
    local button = event.target  -- direct reference to 'btn1' object below

    print( "You pressed and released button " .. button.id )
end

local btn1 = widget.newButton{
    id = "button1",
    label = "Button",
    default = "buttonexample.png",
    over = "buttonexample-over.png",
    onRelease = onButtonRelease
}
